docs.title: Technical Writing Samples
docs.text:
This site is built using MkDocs and the Material theme. It showcases documentation work I've done in support of MD Student News for Indiana University School of Medicine and serves as a live example of my technical writing, Markdown formatting, and documentation architecture skills.

docs.title: Newsletter Setup
docs.text: Newsletter Setup in Salesforce¶

docs.title: 1.  Navigate to Email Studio:
docs.text:
• Click Email Studio in the main menu.
  • Select Content.
  • Open the folder labeled with the upcoming newsletter date.

docs.title: 2. Edit the Newsletter Draft:
docs.text:
• Open the newsletter document in the folder.
  • Begin editing as needed.

docs.title: 3. Insert Content:
docs.text: • Add the approved submissions from the editorial calendar into the newsletter draft.

docs.title: Weekly Newsletter
docs.text: Send every Monday at 5:30 PM ET. We send out six separate versions of the email:

docs.title: 1. Stakeholders Version (One email)
docs.text:
• Very important: Stakeholders are allowed to unsubscribe from the newsletter, so you’ll need to change it to the commercial template.

  • Data Extensions > IN-MED > MD Student News & Events > Admin > Core MSE Stakeholders

  • Data Extensions > IN-MED > MD Student News & Events > Admin > Faculty and Staff Subscribe Form-Students Newsletter
  • When it asks for a publication list, put in MD Student News Stakeholders.

docs.title: 2. Phase-Specific Versions (Four Emails)
docs.text:
• Very important: We don’t want students to unsubscribe, so these emails should use the transactional template.

  • Phase 1 Year 1: Data Extensions > IN-MED > MD Student News & Events > P1Y1_Class of 2028_0824

  • Phase 1 Year 2: Data Extensions > IN-MED > MD Student News & Events > P1Y2_Class of 2027_0824

  • Phase 2: Data Extensions > IN-MED > MD Student News & Events > P2_Class of 2026_0824

  • Phase 3: Data Extensions > IN-MED > MD Student News & Events > P3_Class of 2025_0824

  • Publication list: MD Student Events

docs.title: 3. LOA Version (One Email)
docs.text:
• LOAs are a special case and will need their own version of the email, which will be the stakeholder version with all phase info included. However, we don’t want the students to unsubscribe, so use the transactional template.

  • Data Extensions > IN-MED > MD Student News & Events > LOAs_0824

  • When it asks for a publication list, put in MD Student News Students.

docs.title: Weekly Events
docs.text:
Send every Tuesday at 3:00 PM ET.

!!! important Exception: Not sent between Christmas and New Year and reduced number of emails between June and July due to lack of entries"

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
To document the the step-by-step process for setting up a new employee's workspace.

  • Assigning technology
  • Assisting with initial log-in.
  • Providing printer access, and assigning a phone number.

docs.title: Responsibilities
docs.text: Role: Curriculum Data Coordinator Primary Responsibility: Oversee and complete all onboarding workspace setup tasks.

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text: Onboarding The action or process of integrating a new employee into an organization. HTS Number The number HTS generated to identify and track employee laptops. S/T(Service Tag) The alphanumeric code determines when a laptop warranty expires. Eduroam The standard Wi-Fi connection on the Indiana University Campus, IU Indianapolis, Regional Campuses, and many other universities in the United States and worldwide.

docs.title: Setting Up New Employee Workspace
docs.text:
1. Prepare Office Space

  2. Ensure the following equipment is available in the new employee's office:

    • Two monitors
    • Docking station
    • Mouse and keyboard
    • Web camera
    • Speaker

  3. Device Connectivity

  4. Verify that all devices connect and are operational.

docs.title: Assign a Computer to a New Employee
docs.text:
1. Confirm Equipment Information.
  2. Verify the HTS number with the new employee (indicated by the red label).
  3. Confirm the Service Tag (ST #) with the new employee.
  4. Update Lifecycle Tracking.
  5. Enter and confirm user and laptop information in the Lifecycle Tracking Guide. Access the guide via the designated platform.

docs.title: Assisting New Employees with Initial Log-In
docs.text:
Connect Laptop to Eduroam

  1. Initial Log-In Steps
  2. Instruct the employee to:
    • Select the Wi-Fi icon positioned at the bottom right corner of the screen. Log into the eduroam server using their full email address as the username.
    • Enter the password.
    • Return to the main login screen and log in using only their username and password.
  3. Verification
  4. Ensure that the employee has successfully logged into their laptop.

docs.title: Granting Printer Access to New Employees
docs.text:
1. Access the Printer Directory for the fifth floor of the MERB.
    • Click on the Search bar and type Run.
  2. Type \\IU-OTA-PRNT01 and click Ok.
  3. In the top-right corner of the window, find the Search box labeled Search in IU-OTA-PRNT01.
    • Click inside the search box.
    • Type 191225-HA5003 and press Enter on your keyboard.
  4. Select the printer when it pops up.
  5. Right-Click on the printer then, select open.
  6. Click on the printer tab and select Set as Default Printer

!!! note If the employee does not have access, contact htshelp@iu.edu for assistance.

docs.title: Assigning a Phone Number to a New Employee
docs.text:
1. Access Telecom Services Request
    • Navigate to Telecom Services Request.
  2. **Complete Service Request
    • Click on Internal Services Requests.
    • Select Internal to IU.
  3. Initiate a Teams CallsService Request
  4. Click on Teams Calls Service Request.

  5. Fill out the Teams Calls Service Request with the following values.

    Field Entry Submitted For Another User Account Number 1280098 Campus IN-Indianapolis New phone number needed? Yes Equipment No - We just use headsets USB Type Only required if requesting a phone Equipment Delivery Only required if requesting a phone Details Include building and office/cubicle number

  6. Click Submit.

docs.title: Outlook
docs.text: Follow the steps below to organize and manage submissions for the MD Student News:

docs.title: 1. Organize Email Submissions
docs.text:
• Open the MDS News inbox.

  • Create a folder for each week's edition, using a clear naming convention (e.g., 2025-07-22 Edition).

  • Drag and drop submissions into the appropriate weekly folder.

docs.title: 2. Handling Repeat Submissions
docs.text:
• If a submission needs to be repeated in a future edition:
  • Add the item to the editorial calendar for the desired week.
  • Move a copy of the submission to that week's folder.

docs.title: 3. Check for Updates
docs.text:
• Review all auto-responses carefully.
  • Updates or revisions may be hidden within automatic replies.

docs.title: 4. Create a Weekly Archive Folder
docs.text:
• In Teams or OneDrive, create a folder to store weekly content.

  • Use the following naming format: YYYY-MM-DD_MD Student News (Example: 2025-07-22_MD Student News)

docs.title: Salesforce
docs.text: To request access to Salesforce Marketing Cloud, follow the steps below:

docs.title: 1. Navigate to the access portal
docs.text: • Go to Salesforce Marketing Cloud User Guide

docs.title: 2. Locate the access request form
docs.text: • Scroll down to the "Getting access to Marketing Cloud" section.

docs.title: 3. Open the request form
docs.text: • Click on "Submit an access request form", then select the "User access request form" button.

docs.title: 4. Complete the form as follows
docs.text:
• Username: Enter your IU username (do not include @iu.edu).

  • Request Type: Select Request Access.

  • Include Communication Module Access (Marketing Cloud): Select Yes.

  • Requested IU Units: Enter 7325516 (this is the ID for IN-MED-MSE).

  • User Type: Select Communications User Only.

  • Requested Data Populations: Do not select any boxes.

docs.title: 5. Complete compliance requirements
docs.text:
• Click on each of the Agreements and Tutorials and complete them.

  • Once completed, use the dropdown to select: >“I have completed all required compliance tutorials and agreements.”

docs.title: 6. Submit your request
docs.text: • Scroll to the bottom of the page and click Submit.

docs.title: 7. Follow-up training
docs.text:
• You may receive a follow-up email from IU’s CRM team with required trainings. Please complete them as instructed.

docs.title: Applications used by MD Student News
docs.text: LiveWhale A web-based event management system used to promote and manage events. Salesforce Marketing Cloud Program to create and publish newsletters Sitecore Online application where we publish our news items. Smartsheet An application powered by spreadsheets allowing for the creation of workflows. This application is where we house and schedule our published content.

docs.title: Branding Guidelines
docs.text: Branding & Guidelines¶

docs.title: Dates
docs.text:
• It is Sept. 4 or September 4, not September 4th or Sept. 4th.
  • Preferably abbreviate the month if it's a full date: Sept. 4, 2024.
  • Usually spell it out if not a full date: September 4.
  • I make exceptions for this when I put dates in headlines, to keep headlines at a manageable length.
  • If the date for something is in the same year you’re in (say, 2024), you don’t need to list the year.

docs.title: Times
docs.text:
• It is not 12 pm. It is Noon or noon.
  • AP style says we should be doing it like this: 9 a.m. ET. But it seems that the standard here is 9 am ET—no periods—so just keep doing that.
  • You don’t need to put zeros after a time, so use: 9 am ET instead of 9:00 am ET.
  • On that note, be sure to note the time zone in everything. I’d prefer just to make it ET in all references.

docs.title: Headlines
docs.text:
• Much to my chagrin, Strat Comm wants headlines in sentence case. So a headline would be:
  • “Nick disagrees with Strat Comm team” not “Nick Disagrees with Strat Comm Team.”

!!! Note Exception: Events for the calendar. Title case is fine for those, as they are the proper noun names of the events.

Note: If you’re posting a blog on the website for MD Student News and it is a phase-specific item, go ahead and put that in the headline so they know it’s an item for their attention: “Phase 3: Select Transitions 3 track today”

docs.title: Call to Action
docs.text:
• We get a lot of submissions that have no calls to action: “Phase 2 scheduling guidelines.” It doesn’t tell the reader what to do with it.
  • It doesn’t seem like a big deal, but it really helps to make that explicit: “Class of 2027: Read more about upcoming Phase 2 scheduling guidelines.”

There are some helpful lists online that you can print out that offer lots of call-to-action verbs.

docs.title: Titles
docs.text:
• As you know, we put the person’s academic credentials after their name on first reference: Nick McLain, MD, PhD.
  • On second reference (and third, fourth, etc.), just use their last name—even if they’re a doctor. Don’t put “Dr. McLain wrote this…” – just say “McLain wrote this…”

When using someone’s job title:

  • Capitalize it when used before their name Example: Communications Specialist Nick McLain
  • Do not capitalize it when used after their name Example: Nick McLain, communications specialist, said that…

See the editorial guide for more information
